question:
You have just read an article in a national newspaper which claims that town centres in your country all look very similiar to each other. You dont fully agree with this opinion. 
Write a letter to the editor of the newspaper. In your letter
say which point in the article you agree with
explain ways in which your town centre is different from most other town centres
offer to give a guided tour of your town to the writer of the article
text: I am your loyal reader over a decade, your article is very inspiring that is given me an refreshment in my daily life. In the recent article, your article was introduced my hometown, I was so exicted about it.

My hometown is one of financial hub in the world. It has many high rise buildings, which similiar as New York, Shanghai, Tokyo. I do agree with this point as Hong Kong is very much similiar with  them as these cities are never stop even at night time.

In Hong Kong, tram is one of the public transportation, which is still up and run in the modern city. Comparing with New York, Shanghai and Tokyo, this type of public transportation cannot be found in modern city as this type of inefficient public transportation have already been replaced by bus, cars.
I wish I can have an opportunity to have a day tour with you to explore my hometown, which can have an explorement on other side of Hong Kong, which is mixed with historical and modern city.
My name is May, my contact number is: 123456 and my email address is: [email protected]
Looking forward to receiving your reply.
